name: Predictable Exact Value from Previous Values
description: An exact value or random number can be precisely predicted by observing previous values.

x_mitre_observed_examples.description: Firewall generates easily predictable initial sequence numbers (ISN), which allows remote attackers to spoof connections.
Listening TCP ports are sequentially allocated, allowing spoofing attacks.
Predictable TCP sequence numbers allow spoofing.
DNS resolver uses predictable IDs, allowing a local user to spoof DNS query results.

x_mitre_potential_mitigations.description: Increase the entropy used to seed a PRNG.
Use products or modules that conform to FIPS 140-2 [REF-267] to avoid obvious entropy problems. Consult FIPS 140-2 Annex C ("Approved Random Number Generators").

Use a PRNG that periodically re-seeds itself using input from high-quality sources, such as hardware devices with high entropy. However, do not re-seed too frequently, or else the entropy source might block.
